The developers of the [[OSx86]] Project claimed that Psystar did not get permission to use their code and then reworked their license so that it specifically forbids commercial usage.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.engadget.com/2008/04/16/osx86-project-not-too-happy-with-psystar-either/ |title=OSx86 Project not too happy with Psystar either |accessdate=Sept 17, 2008 |publisher=Engadge |date=2008-04-16 |author= Patel, Nilay}}</ref>
The developers of the [[OSx86]] Project claimed that Psystar did not get permission to use their code and then reworked their license so that it specifically forbids commercial usage.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.engadget.com/2008/04/16/osx86-project-not-too-happy-with-psystar-either/ |title=OSx86 Project not too happy with Psystar either |accessdate=Sept 17, 2008 |publisher=Engadge |date=2008-04-16 |author= Patel, Nilay}}</ref>
  +   +
== Rebel EFI ==
  +
Rebel EFI is a product from Pystar that helps users to install Mac OS X on "regular" x86 computers. A trial version is free of charge, but the full version costs money.
== Legal issues ==
